questions.questionsTitle: In a hostel there are 125 students, out of which 80 drink tea, 60 drink coffee and 20 drink tea and coffee both. Find the number of students who do not drink tea or coffee.

subQuestion.question: In a hostel there are 125 students, out of which 80 drink tea, 60 drink coffee and 20 drink tea and coffee both. Find the number of students who do not drink tea or coffee.
subQuestion.ans: Let A be the set of students who drink tea, and B be the set of students who drink coffee.We have,n(U) = 125, n(A) = 80, n(B) = 60, n(A ∩ B) = 20Since,n(A ∪ B) = n(A) + n(B) - n(A ∩ B)= 80 + 60 - 20n(A ∪ B) = 120So, the number of students who do not drink tea or coffee = 125 - 120 = 5

questions.questionsTitle: In a competitive exam 50 students passed in English. 60 students passed in Mathematics. 40 students passed in both the subjects. None of them fail in both the subjects. Find the number of students who passed at least in one of the subjects?

subQuestion.question: In a competitive exam 50 students passed in English. 60 students passed in Mathematics. 40 students passed in both the subjects. None of them fail in both the subjects. Find the number of students who passed at least in one of the subjects?
subQuestion.ans: Let A be the set of students who passed in English, and B be the set of students who passed in Mathematics.We have,n(A) = 50, n(B) = 60, n(A ∩ B) = 40Since,n(A ∪ B) = n(A) + n(B) - n(A ∩ B)= 50 + 60 - 40n(A ∪ B) = 70So, the number of students who passed at least in one of the subjects is 70.

questions.questionsTitle: A survey was conducted to know the hobby of 220 students of class IX. Out of which 130 students informed about their hobby as rock climbing and 180 students informed about their hobby as sky watching. There are 110 students who follow both the hobbies. Then how many students do not have any of the two hobbies? How many of them follow the hobby of rock climbing only? How many students follow the hobby of sky watching only?

subQuestion.question: A survey was conducted to know the hobby of 220 students of class IX. Out of which 130 students informed about their hobby as rock climbing and 180 students informed about their hobby as sky watching. There are 110 students who follow both the hobbies. Then how many students do not have any of the two hobbies? How many of them follow the hobby of rock climbing only? How many students follow the hobby of sky watching only?
subQuestion.ans: Let A be the set of students who follow the hobby of rock climbing, and B be the set of students who follow the hobby of sky watching.We have, n(A) = 130, n(B) = 180, n(A ∩ B) = 110, n(U) = 220Since,n(A ∪ B) = n(A) + n(B) - n(A ∩ B)= 130 + 180 - 110= 200So, the number of students who do not have any of the two hobbies= n(U) - n(A ∪ B)= 220 - 200= 20Also, the number of students who follow the hobby of rock climbing only= n(A) - n(A ∩ B)= 130 - 110= 20And, the number of students who follow the hobby of sky watching only= n(B) - n(A ∩ B)= 180 - 110= 70

questions.questionsTitle: Out of 100 persons in a group, 72 persons speak English and 43 persons speak French. Each one out of 100 persons speak at least one language. Then how many speak only English? How many speak only French? How many of them speak English and French both?

subQuestion.question: Out of 100 persons in a group, 72 persons speak English and 43 persons speak French. Each one out of 100 persons speak at least one language. Then how many speak only English? How many speak only French? How many of them speak English and French both?
subQuestion.ans: Let A be the set of persons speaking English and B be the set of persons speaking French.So, n(A) = 72; n(B) = 43; n(A ∪ B) = 100Now,n(A) + n(B) = n(A ∪ B) + n(A ∩ B)⇒ n(A ∩ B) = 72 + 43 - 100⇒ n(A ∩ B) = 15So, the number of person who speak French and English both is 15.Also,n(A) = n(A - B) + n(A ∩ B)⇒ n(A - B) = 72 - 15⇒ n(A - B) = 57So, the number of person who speak only English is 57.And,n(B) = n(B - A) + n(A ∩ B)⇒ n(B - A) = 43 - 15⇒ n(B - A) = 28So, the number of person who speak only French is 28.

subQuestion.ans: Let A be the set of trees planted by Parth and B be the set of trees planted by Pradnya.So, n(A) = 70; n(B) = 90; n(A ∩ B) = 25n(A ∪ B) =?Now, n(A ∪ B) = n(A) + n(B) - n(A ∩ B)n(A ∪ B) = 70 + 90 - 25n(A ∪ B) = 135Hence, the number of trees planted by Parth or Pradnya is 135.

subQuestion.question: In a class, 8 students out of 28 have a dog as their pet animal at home, 6 students have a cat as their pet animal. 10 students have dog and cat both, then how many students do not have a dog or cat as their pet animal at home?
subQuestion.ans: Let U be the universe of students in a class, D is the set of dog keepers, and C is the set of students who keep cats.We have,Total number of students = 28;n (U) = 28n (D) = n (dog only) + n (dog and cat)= 8 + 10 = 18n (C) = n (Cat only) + n (dog and cat)= 6 + 10 = 16n (D ∪ C) = n (D) + n (C) - n (D ∩ C)= 18 + 16 - 10= 34 - 10= 24Students who do not have a pet= n (U) - n (D ∪ C)= 28 - 24= 4So, the number of students that do not have a dog or a cat as their pet is 4.

There is a rectangular farm with length `(2a^2 + 3b^2)` metre and breadth `(a^2 + b^2)` metre. The farmer used a square shaped plot of the farm to build a house. The side of the plot was `(a^2 -  b^2)` metre.What is the area of the remaining part of the farm?

subQuestion.question: There is a rectangular farm with length `(2a^2 + 3b^2)` metre and breadth `(a^2 + b^2)` metre. The farmer used a square shaped plot of the farm to build a house. The side of the plot was `(a^2 -  b^2)` metre.What is the area of the remaining part of the farm?
subQuestion.ans: Lenght of the rectangular farm = (2a2+ 3b2) mBreadth of the rectangular farm = (a2+ b2) mThe total area of the farm = Length of the rectangular farm × Breadth of the rectangular farm= (2a2+ 3b2) × (a2+ b2)= 2a2(a2+ b2) + 3b2(a2+ b2)= 2a4+ 2a2b2+3a2b2+ 3b4= (2a4+ 5a2b2+ 3b2) sq.meterSide of the square plot = (a2− b2) meter.Area of the square plot = (side)2=  (a2− b2)2= a − 2a2b2+ b4Area of the remaining part of the farm = Total area of the farm − Area of the square plot= (2a4+ 5a2b2+ 3b4) - (a4− 2a2b2+ b4)= 2a4+ 5a2b2+ 3b4− a4− 2a2b2+ b4= 2a4− a4+ 5a2b2+ 2a2b2+ 3b4− b4= a4+ 7a2b2+ 2b4Thus, the area of the remaining part of the farm is (a4+ 7a2b2+ 2b4) sq.

questions.questionsTitle: If x - 2 and  `x - 1/2` both are the factors of the polynomial  nx2− 5x + m, then show that  m = n = 2

subQuestion.question: If x - 2 and  `x - 1/2` both are the factors of the polynomial  nx2− 5x + m, then show that  m = n = 2
subQuestion.ans: Let p(x) = nx2− 5x + m.It given that (x − 2) and `(x - 1/2) `are the factors of the polynomial p(x) = nx2− 5x + m.∴ By factor theorem, p(2) = 0 and `p(1/2) = 0`.p(2) = 0⇒ n ×(2)2− 5 × 2 + m = 0⇒ 4n − 10 + m = 0⇒ 4n + m = 10       ...(1)Also,`p(1/2) = 0`⇒ `n(1/2)^2 - 5 xx 1/2 + m = 0`⇒ `n/4 + m = 5/2`⇒ n + 4m = 10      ...(2)From (1) and (2), we have4n + m = n + 4m⇒ 4n − n = 4m − m⇒ 3n = 3m⇒ n = mPutting n = m in (1), we have4m + m = 10⇒ 5m = 10⇒ m = 2∴ n = m = 2

questions.questionsTitle: At the end of the year 2016, the population of villages Kovad, Varud, Chikhali is 5x2- 3y2, 7y2+ 2xy and 9x2+ 4xy respectively. subQuestion.question: At the end of the year 2016, the population of villages Kovad, Varud, Chikhali is 5x2- 3y2, 7y2+ 2xy and 9x2+ 4xy respectively. At the beginning of the year 2017, x2+ xy - y2, 5xy and 3x2+ xy persons from each of the three villages respectively went to another village for education then what is the remaining total population of these three villages?
subQuestion.ans: Total population of the three villages= (5x2- 3y2) + (7y2+ 2xy) + (9x2+ 4xy)= 5x2+ 9x2- 3y2+ 7y2+ 2xy + 4xy= 14x2+ 4y2+ 6xyTotal number of persons who went to another village for education= (x2+ xy - y2) + 5xy + (3x2+ xy)= x2+ 3x2- y2+ xy + 5xy + xy= 4x2- y2+ 7xy∴ Remaining total population of the three villages = Total population of the three villages − Total number of persons who went to another village for education= (14x2+ 4y2+ 6xy) - (4x2- y2+ 7xy)= 14x2+ 4y2+ 6xy - 4x2+ y2- 7xy= 14x2- 4x2+ 4y2+ y2+ 6xy - 7xy= 10x2+ 5y2- xyThus, the remaining total population of these three villages is 10x2+ 5y2− xy.

questions.questionsTitle: Polynomials bx2+ x + 5 and bx3− 2x + 5 are divided by polynomial x - 3 and the remainders are m and n respectively. If m − n = 0 then find the value of b.

subQuestion.question: Polynomials bx2+ x + 5 and bx3− 2x + 5 are divided by polynomial x - 3 and the remainders are m and n respectively. If m − n = 0 then find the value of b.
subQuestion.ans: Let p(x) = bx2+ x + 5 and q(x) = bx3- 2x + 5.The remainder when p(x) = bx2+ x + 5 is divided by (x − 3) is m.By remainder theorem,Remainder = p(3) = m∴ b × (3)2+ 3 + 5 = m⇒ m = 9b + 8        ...(1)The remainder when q(x) = bx3− 2x + 5 is divided by (x - 3) is n.By remainder theorem,Remainder = q(3) = n∴ b × (3)3− 2 × 3 + 5 = n⇒ n = 27b − 6 + 5⇒ n = 27b − 1   ...(2)Now,m − n = 0⇒ (9b + 8) - (27b − 1) = 0     [Using (1) and (2)]⇒ 9b − 27b + 8 + 1 = 0⇒ −18b + 9 = 0⇒ −18b = −9`⇒ b = (−9)/(−18) = 1/2`Thus, the value of b is `1/2`.

subQuestion.question: Which polynomial is to be subtracted from x2+ 13x + 7 to get the polynomial  3x2+ 5x − 4?
subQuestion.ans: Let p(x) be the polynomial which is to be subtracted from x2+ 13x + 7 to get the polynomial  3x2+ 5x − 4.∴ (x2+ 13x + 7) − p(x) = 3x2+ 5x − 4⇒ p(x) = (x2+ 13x + 7) − (3x2+ 5x − 4)⇒ p(x) = x2+ 13x + 7 − 3x2− 5x + 4⇒ p(x) = x2− 3x2+ 13x − 5x + 7 + 4⇒ p(x) = −2x2+ 8x + 11Thus, the required polynomial is −2x2+ 8x + 11.

subQuestion.ans: The required polynomial can be obtained by subtracting the polynomial 4m + 2n + 3 from 6m + 3n + 10.∴ Required polynomial∴ (4m + 2n + 3) + p(a) = (6m + 3n + 10)∴ p(a) = (6m + 3n + 10) − (4m + 2n + 3)= 6m + 3n + 10 − 4m − 2n − 3= 6m − 4m + 3n − 2n + 10 − 3= 2m + n + 7Thus, the polynomial 2m + n + 7 is to be added to 4m + 2n + 3 to get the polynomial 6m + 3n + 10.

subQuestion.ans: Let the number of Rs 5 notes be x and the number of Rs 10 notes be y.5x + 10y = 350     ...(I)Number of 5 rupee notes are less by 10 than twice number of 10 rupee notes∴ x = 2y – 10∴ x – 2y = –10   ...(II)Multiplying equation (II) by 5,5x – 10y = –50    ...(III)Adding equations (I) and (III)5x + 10y = 350+   5x – 10y = –5010x =   300∴  x =`300/10`∴  x = 30Substituting x = 30 in equation (II),x – 2y = –1030 – 2y = –10∴  30 + 10 = 2y∴  40 = 2y∴  y = `40/2`∴  y = 20Number of Rs 5 notes = 30, number of Rs 10 notes = 20

subQuestion.ans: Let numerator of fraction be x  and its denominator be y.required fraction = `"x"/"y"`y = 2x - 12x - y = 1       ...(1)`("x" + 1)/("y" + 1) = 3/5 `∴ 5 (x + 1) = 3 (y + 1)∴ 5x + 5 = 3y + 3∴ 5x - 3y = 3 - 5∴ 5x - 3y = - 2       ...(2)Multiply equation (1) by (3)6x - 3y = 3      ...(3)Subtracting equation (2) from (3)6x − 3y = 35x − 3y = −2−    +       +x           = 5∴ x = 5Putting x = 5 in equation (1)∴ 2 (5) - y = 1∴ 10 - y = 1∴ - y = - 9y = 9∴ required fraction is `"x"/"y" = 5/9`

subQuestion.ans: 2x + y = -2     ...(I)3x - y = 7       ...(II)Adding (I) and (II)5x = 5⇒ x = 1Putting the value of x in (I)2 × 1 + y = -2⇒ 2 + y = -2⇒ y = - 4

questions.questionsTitle: Solve the following simultaneous equation.

subQuestion.question: 2x - y = 5 ; 3x + 2y = 11
subQuestion.ans: 2x - y = 5     ...(I)3x + 2y = 11    ...(II)Multiplying (I) with 2 we get4x - 2y = 10    ...(III)Adding (II) with (III)3x + 2y = 11+ 4x - 2y = 107x     =    21⇒ x = 3Putting the value of x in (I) we get∴ 2x - y = 5⇒ 2 × 3 - y = 5⇒ 6 - y = 5⇒ y = 1

questions.questionsTitle: Solve the following simultaneous equation.

subQuestion.question: x − 2y = −2 ; x + 2y = 10
subQuestion.ans: x − 2y = −2    ...(I)x + 2y = 10    ...(II)Adding (I) and (II)x − 2y = −2+ x + 2y = 102x = 8⇒ x = 4Putting the value of x in (I) we get∴ x - 2y = −2⇒ 4 − 2y = −2⇒ −2y = −6⇒ y = 3

questions.questionsTitle: By equating coefficients of variables, solve the following equations.

subQuestion.question: 3x - 4y = 7; 5x + 2y = 3
subQuestion.ans: 3x - 4y = 7    ...(I)5x + 2y  = 3   ...(II)Multiply (II) with 210x + 4y  = 6     ...(III)Adding (I) and (III)3x - 4y = 710x + 4y  = 613x = 13⇒ x = 1Putting the value of x in (I) we get∴ 3x - 4y = 7⇒ 3 × 1 - 4y = 7⇒ 3 - 4y = 7⇒ y = -1Thus, x = 1 and y = -1

questions.questionsTitle: By equating coefficients of variables, solve the following equation.

subQuestion.question: 5x + 7y = 17 ; 3x - 2y = 4
subQuestion.ans: 5x + 7y = 17    ...(I)3x - 2y  = 4     ...(II)Multiply (I) with 3 and (II) with 515x + 21y = 51   ...(III)15x - 10y = 20     ...(IV)Subtracting (IV) from (III) we get,15x + 21y = 5115x - 10y = 20-       +           -31y = 31⇒ y = 1Putting this value of y in (I) we get∴ 5x + 7y = 175x + 7 × 1 = 17⇒ 5x = 10⇒ x = 2Thus, x = 2, y = 1

questions.questionsTitle: By equating coefficients of variables, solve the following equation.

subQuestion.question: x − 2y = −10 ; 3x − 5y = −12
subQuestion.ans: x − 2y  = −10    ...(I)3x − 5y = −12    ...(II)Multiply (I) with 33x − 6y = −30     ...(III)Subtracting (II) from (III) we get,3x − 6y = −303x − 5y = −12-       +        +−y = −18⇒ y = 18Putting the value of y in (I) we get,∴ x − 2y  = −10⇒ x − 2 × 18 = −10⇒ x = −10 + 36 = 26Thus, x = 26, y = 18

questions.questionsTitle: By equating coefficients of variables, solve the following equation.

subQuestion.question: 4x + y = 34 ; x + 4y = 16
subQuestion.ans: 4x + y = 34    ...(I)x + 4y = 16    ...(II)Adding (I) and (II) we get,4x + y = 34x + 4y = 165x + 5y = 50⇒ x + y = 10    ...(III)Subtracting (II) from (I) we get,4x + y = 34x + 4y = 16-    -        -3x - 3y = 18⇒ x - y = 6    ...(IV)Adding (III) and (IV) we get,x + y = 10x - y = 62x = 16⇒ x = 8Putting the value of x in (I) we get,∴ 4x + y = 34⇒ 4 (8) + y = 34⇒ y = 34 - 32⇒ y = 2Thus, x = 8, y = 2

questions.questionsTitle: Solve the following simultaneous equation.

subQuestion.question: `x/3 + y/4 = 4; x/2 - y/4 = 1`
subQuestion.ans: `x/3 + y/4 = 4`    ...(I)`x/2 - y/4 = 1`     ...(II)Multiplying (I) with LCM of 3 and 4 which is 12, we get,4x + 3y = 48   ...(III)Multiplying (II) with LCM of 2 and 4 which is 4, we get,2x - y = 4     ...(IV)Multiplying (IV) with 2,4x - 2y = 8       ...(V)Subtracting (V) from (III)4x + 3y = 484x - 2y = 8-     +         -5y = 40⇒ y = 8Putting this value of y in (IV) we get,∴ 2x - y = 4⇒ 2x - 8 = 4⇒ 2x = 12⇒ x = 6.

questions.questionsTitle: Solve the following simultaneous equation.

subQuestion.question: `x/3 + 5y = 13 ; 2x + y/2 = 19`
subQuestion.ans: `x/3 + 5y = 13`     ...(I)x + 15y = 13 × 3∴ x + 15y = 39    ...(II)`2x + y/2 = 19`    ...(III)`(4x+y)/2 = 19`4x + y = 19 × 2∴ 4x + y = 38    ...(IV)Multiplying (II) with 4 we get,4x + 60y = 156    ...(V)Subtracting (IV) from (V),4x + 60y = 1564x + y   =   38-      -          -59y = 118⇒ y = 2Putting the value of y in (IV) we get,∴ 4x + y = 38⇒ 4x + 2 = 38⇒ 4x = 36⇒ x = 9

questions.questionsTitle: Solve the following simultaneous equation.

subQuestion.question: `2/x + 3/y = 13` ; `5/x - 4/y = -2`
subQuestion.ans: `2/x + 3/y = 13` ; `5/x - 4/y = -2`Let `1/x = u and 1/y = v`So, the equations obtained are2u + 3v = 13     ...(I)       (× 5)5u - 4v = -2      ...(II)      (× 2)10u + 15v = 65    ...(III)10u - 8v = - 4      ...(IV)Subtracting (IV) from (III)10u + 15v = 6510u - 8v = - 4-        +         +23v = 69⇒ v = 3Putting the value of v in (I)∴ 2u + 3v = 13⇒ 2u + 3 × 3 = 13⇒ 2u = 4⇒ u = 2`1/x = u ⇒ x = 1/u = 1/2``1/y = v  ⇒ y = 1/v = 1/3`

questions.questionsTitle: A two digit number is 3 more than 4 times the sum of its digits. If 18 is added to this  number, the sum is equal to the number obtained by interchanging the digits. Find the  number.

subQuestion.question: A two digit number is 3 more than 4 times the sum of its digits. If 18 is added to this  number, the sum is equal to the number obtained by interchanging the digits. Find the  number.
subQuestion.ans: Let the two digit number be 10x + y.A two digit number is 3 more than 4 times the sum of its digits.10x + y = 4 (x + y) + 3⇒ 10x + y = 4x + 4y + 3⇒ 2x - y = 1   ...(I)If 18 is added to this number, the sum is equal to the number obtained by interchanging the digits.10x + y + 18 = 10y + x⇒ 9x - 9y = - 18⇒ x - y = - 2    ...(II)(I) - (II)2x - y = 1x - y = - 2-   +       +x  =  3Put x = 3 in equation (II)∴ x - y = - 2∴ 3 - y = - 2∴ 3 + 2 = y∴ y = 5∴ The required number = 10x + y= 10 × 3 + 5= 30 + 5= 35Thus, the number obtained is 35.

questions.questionsTitle: The total cost of 8 books and 5 pens is 420 rupees and the total cost of 5 books and 8 pens is 321 rupees. Find the cost of 1 book and 2 pens.

subQuestion.question: The total cost of 8 books and 5 pens is 420 rupees and the total cost of 5 books and 8 pens is 321 rupees. Find the cost of 1 book and 2 pens.
subQuestion.ans: Let the cost of 1 book be x and the cost of 1 pen be y.According to the first condition, the total cost of 8 books and 5 pens is 420 rupees.∴ 8x + 5y = 420    ...(I)According to the Second condition, the total cost of 5 books and 8 pens is 321 rupees.5x + 8y = 321    ...(II)Multiplying equation (I) by 540x + 25y = 2100      ...(III)Multiplying equation (II) by 840x + 64y = 2568    ...(IV)equation (IV) - (III)40x + 64y = 2568-  40x + 25y = 210039y = 468∴  y = `468/39`∴  y = 12Putting the value of y = 12 in equation (I)8x + 5y = 420⇒ 8x + 5 (12) = 420⇒ 8x + 60 = 420⇒ 8x = 420 - 60⇒ 8x = 360⇒ x = `360/8`∴ x = 45Cost of 1 book and 2 pens = x + 2y= 45 + 2 (12)= Rs.

questions.questionsTitle: The ratio of incomes of two persons is 9 : 7. The ratio of their expenses is 4 : 3. Every person saves rupees 200, find the income of each.

subQuestion.question: The ratio of incomes of two persons is 9 : 7. The ratio of their expenses is 4 : 3. Every person saves rupees 200, find the income of each.
subQuestion.ans: Let the incomes of the two persons be x and y.`x/y` = `9/7`⇒ 7x = 9y⇒ 7x − 9y  = 0    ...(I)Savings of the two persons = Rs 200Expenses = Income − Savings`(x − 200)/(y − 200) = 4/3`∴ 3(x − 200) = 4(y − 200)⇒ 3x − 600 = 4y − 800⇒ 3x − 4y = −200    ...(II)Multiply (I) with 3 and (II) with 7.21x − 27y = 0    ...(III)21x − 28y = −1400    ...(IV)(IV) − (III)21x − 28y = −140021x − 27y = 0−      +           −−y = −1400⇒ y = 1400Putting the value y = 1400 in (I) we get∴ 7x − 9y  = 0∴ 7x − 9(1400) = 0∴ 7x − 12600 = 0∴ 7x = 12600∴ x = `12600/7`⇒ x = 1800Thus, the income of the two persons is Rs 1800 and Rs 1400.

questions.questionsTitle: The distance between two places A and B on road is 70 kilometers. A car starts from A and the other from B. If they travel in the same direction, they will meet after 7 hours. If they travel towards each other they will meet after 1 hour, then find their speeds.

subQuestion.question: The distance between two places A and B on road is 70 kilometers. A car starts from A and the other from B. If they travel in the same direction, they will meet after 7 hours. If they travel towards each other they will meet after 1 hour, then find their speeds.
subQuestion.ans: Let the speed of the faster car be x km/h and that of the slower car be y km/h.Total distance between them is 70 km.Speed = ` "Distance" / "Time"`When both cars travel in the same direction, they meet in 7 hours.Total speed = x − y`x - y = 70/7`⇒ x - y = 10    ...(I)When both cars move towards each other,Total speed = x + y`x + y = 70/1`⇒ x + y = 70     ...(II)Adding (I) and (II)x - y = 10x + y = 702x   =  80⇒ x = 40Putting the value of x in (I)∴ x - y = 10∴ 40 - y = 10∴ y = 40 - 10⇒ y = 30∴ The speed of a car starting from A is 40 km/hr and the speed of a car starting from B is 30 km/hr.

questions.questionsTitle: The sum of a two digit number and the number obtained by interchanging its digits is 99. Find the number.

subQuestion.question: The sum of a two digit number and the number obtained by interchanging its digits is 99. Find the number.
subQuestion.ans: Let x be the unit's digit and y the tens digit.∴ Two digit number = 10y + xNumber obtained on interchanging the digits = 10x + y.The sum of a two digit number and the number obtained by interchanging its digits is 99.10x + y + 10y + x = 99⇒ 11x + 11y = 99Divide both sides by 11⇒ x + y = 9If x = 1, then y = 8,If x = 2, then y = 7, etc.With the given information, only one equation can be formed.So, the number can be 81, 72, 63, 54.

questions.questionsTitle: Decimal expansion of which of the following is non-terminating recurring?

subQuestion.question: Decimal expansion of which of the following is non-terminating recurring?
subQuestion.ans: `bb(3/11)`Explanation:1) Since, `5 = 2^0 xx 5^1`, which is in the form of `2^m xx 5^n`, where m and n are non-negative integers.So, the decimal expansion of `2/5` is terminating.2) Since, `16 = 2^4 xx 5^0`, which in the form of `2^m xx 5^n` , where m and n are non-negative integers.So, the decimal expansion of `3/16` is terminating.3) Since, `11 = 2^0 xx 5^0 xx 11^1`, which is not in the form of `2^m xx 5^n`, where m and n are non-negative integers.So, the decimal expansion of `3/11` is non-terminating recurring.4) Since, `25 = 2^0 xx 5^2`, which is in the form of `2^m xx 5^n`, where m and n are non-negative integers.So, the decimal expansion of `137/25` is terminating.

Show that `5 +sqrt 7`  is an irrational number.

subQuestion.question: Show that `5 +sqrt 7`  is an irrational number.
subQuestion.ans: Let us assume that `5 +sqrt 7` is a rational number.⇒ `5 +sqrt 7 = p/q`, where p and q are two integers and q ≠ 0⇒ `sqrt 7 = p/q - 5 = (p-5q)/q`Since, p, q and 5 are integers, so `(p - 5q)/ q` is a rational number.But this contradicts the fact that `sqrt 7` is an irrational number.This contradiction has arisen due to our assumption that  `5 +sqrt 7` is a rational number.Hence, `5 +sqrt 7` is an irrational number.

subQuestion.question: The ratio of ages of Abha and her mother is 2 : 5. At the time of Abha's birth her mothers age was 27 year. Find the present ages of Abha and her mother.
subQuestion.ans: The ratio of the present ages of Abha and her mother is 2 : 5.Let the present age of Abha and her mother be 2x years and 5x years, respectively.∴ Abha's mother age at the time of Abha's birth = 5x − 2x = 3x yearsIt is given that at the time of Abha's birth her mothers age was 27 year.∴ 3x = 27⇒ x = 9∴ Present age of Abha = 2x = 2 × 9 = 18 yearsPresent age of Abha's mother = 5x = 5 × 9 = 45 yearsThus, the present age of Abha and her mother is 18 years and 45 years, respectively.

subQuestion.question: Present ages of Vatsala and Sara are 14 years and 10 years respectively. After how many years the ratio of their ages will become 5 : 4?
subQuestion.ans: Let after x years, the ratio of their ages will become 5 : 4.Age of Vatsala after x years = (14 + x) yearsAge of Sara after x years = (10 + x) years∴ `(14+x) / (10+x) = 5/4`⇒ 56 + 4x = 50 + 5x⇒ 5x - 4x = 56 - 50⇒ x = 6Thus, the ratio of their ages will become 5 : 4 after 6 years.

subQuestion.ans: Quadrilateral ABCD is a parallelogram.Let the measure of `angle`A and `angle` B be 5xº and 4xº, respectively.Now,`angle` A + `angle` B = 180º    ...(Adjacent angles of a parallelogram are supplementary)∴5xº + 4xº = 180º⇒ 9xº = 180º⇒ xº = 20º∴ Measure of `angle`B = 4xº = 4 × 20º = 80ºThus, the measure of `angle`B is 80º.

subQuestion.question: The ratio of present ages of Albert and Salim is 5 : 9. Five years hence ratio of their ages will be 3 : 5. Find their present ages.
subQuestion.ans: Let the present ages of Albert and Salim be 5x years and 9x years, respectively.5 years hence,Age of Albert = (5x + 5) yearsAge of Salim = (9x + 5) yearsIt is given that five year hence, the ratio of their ages will be 3 : 5.`therefore (5x + 5)/(9x + 5) = 3/5`⇒ 25x + 25 = 27x + 15⇒ 27x - 25x = 25 - 15⇒ 2x = 10⇒ x = 5∴ Present age of Albert = 5x = 5 × 5 = 25 yearsPresent age of Salim = 9x = 9 × 5 = 45 yearsThus, the present age of Albert is 25 years and the present age of Salim is 45 years.

questions.questionsTitle: Solve the following equation.

subQuestion.question: `(x^2 + 12x - 20)/(3x - 5) = (x^2 + 8x + 12)/(2x + 3)`
subQuestion.ans: `(x^2 + 12x -20)/( 3x - 5 ) = (x^2 + 8x + 12)/( 2x + 3 )`Multiplying both sides by `1/4`, we get`(x^2 + 12x -20)/( 12x - 20 ) = (x^2 + 8x + 12)/( 8x + 12 )`Using dividendo, we get`[(x^2 + 12x -20) - ( 12x - 20 )]/( 12x - 20 ) = [(x^2 + 8x + 12) - ( 8x + 12 )]/ ( 8x + 12 )`⇒ `[x^2 + 12x -20 - 12x + 20 ]/( 12x - 20 ) = [x^2 + 8x + 12 -  8x - 12 ]/ ( 8x + 12 )`⇒ `x^2/( 12x - 20 ) = x^2/ ( 8x + 12 )`This equation is true for x = 0.Therefore, x = 0 is a solution of the given equation.If x ≠ 0, then x2≠ 0.Dividing both sides by x2, we get`1/(12x - 20)= 1/(8x + 12)`⇒ 12x - 20 = 8x + 12⇒ 12x - 8x = 20 + 12⇒ 4x = 32⇒ x = 8Thus, the solutions of the given equation are x = 0 and x = 8.

subQuestion.question: `[sqrt( 4x + 1) + sqrt( x + 3 )]/[sqrt( 4x + 1 ) - sqrt( x+3 )]=4/1`
subQuestion.ans: `[sqrt( 4x + 1) + sqrt( x + 3 )]/[sqrt( 4x + 1 ) - sqrt( x+3 )]=4/1`Applying componendo and dividendo, we get`{[sqrt( 4x + 1) + sqrt( x + 3 )] + [sqrt( 4x + 1 ) - sqrt( x+3 )]} /{[sqrt( 4x + 1) + sqrt( x + 3 )] - [sqrt( 4x + 1 ) - sqrt( x+3 )]}=(4+1)/(4-1)`⇒ `(2sqrt[4x+1])/ (2sqrt[x + 3]) = 5/3`⇒ `sqrt[4x+1]/sqrt[x + 3] = 5/3`Squaring on both sides, we get`(4x + 1)/(x +3) = (5/3)^2`⇒ `(4x + 1)/(x +3) = 25/9`⇒ `9(4x + 1) + 25(x +3)`⇒ `36x +9 = 25x + 75`⇒ `36x - 25x = 75 - 9`⇒ `11x = 66`⇒ `x = 6`Thus, the solution of the given equation is x = 6.

subQuestion.question: `( 5y^2 + 40y - 12)/( 5y + 10y^2 - 4) = ( y + 8)/( 1 + 2y)`
subQuestion.ans: `( 5y^2 + 40y - 12)/( 5y + 10y^2 - 4) = ( y + 8)/( 1 + 2y)`If y = 0, then `[5 xx 0 + 40 xx 0 - 12]/[ 5 xx 0 + 10 xx 0 - 4 ] = (0+8)/( 1 + 2 xx 0 ) ⇒ { -12}/{ - 4 } = 8/1`So, y = 0 is not a solution of the given equation.Now,⇒ `( 5y^2 + 40y - 12)/( 5y + 10y^2 - 4) = [5y( y + 8)]/[ 5y( 1 +2y)]`    ...[Multiplying numerator and denominator of second ratio by 5y]⇒ `[ 5y^2 + 40y - 12 - 5y^2 - 40y ]/[ 5y + 10y^2 - 4 - 5y - 10y^2 ]`    ...(Theorem of equal ratios)⇒ `[-12]/[-4]``therefore ( y + 8)/( 1 +2y) = [-12]/[-4] = 3/1`⇒ y + 8 = 3(1 + 2y)⇒ y + 8 = 3 + 6y⇒ 6y − y = 8 − 3⇒ 5y = 5⇒ y = 1Thus, the solution of the given equation is y = 1.

questions.questionsTitle: Which number should be subtracted from 12, 16 and 21 so that resultant numbers are in continued proportion?

subQuestion.question: Which number should be subtracted from 12, 16 and 21 so that resultant numbers are in continued proportion?
subQuestion.ans: Let the number x be subtracted from 12, 16 and 21 so that the resultant numbers are in continued proportion.∴ (12 − x), (16 − x), (21 − x) are in continued proportion.∴ `(12 − x)/(16 − x) = (16 − x)/(21 − x)`∴ `((12 − x) - (16 - x))/(16 - x) = ((16 - x) - (21 - x))/(21 - x)`  ...(Using Dividendo)∴ `(12 - x - 16 + x)/(16 - x) = (16 - x - 21 + x)/(21 - x)`∴ `(-4)/(16 - x) = (-5)/(21 - x)`∴ −4 (21 − x) = −5 (16 − x)∴ −84 + 4x = −80 + 5x∴ −84 + 80 = 5x − 4x∴ −4 = x∴ x = −4Thus, the number −4 must be subtracted from 12, 16 and 21 so that the resultant numbers are in continued proportion.

subQuestion.question: Three numbers are in continued proportion, whose mean proportional is 12 and the sum of the remaining two numbers is 26, then find these numbers.
subQuestion.ans: Let the remaining two numbers be x and y.So, the numbers x, 12, y are in continued proportion.​∴ xy = (12)2= 144   ...(1)Also,x + y = 26    ...(2)Solving (1) and (2), we get`x + 144/x = 26`⇒ `(x^2+144)/x=26`⇒ `x^2 + 144 = 26x`⇒ `x^2 - 26x +144 = 0`⇒ `x^2 - 18x - 8x + 144 = 0`⇒ `x( x - 18) - 8( x - 18) = 0`⇒ `( x - 18 )( x - 8 )=0`⇒ `x - 8 = 0 or x - 18 = 0`⇒ `x = 8 or x = 18`when x = 8, y = 26 - 8 = 18  ...[using 2]when x = 18, y = 26 - 18 = 8Thus, the numbers are 8, 12, 18 or 18, 12, 8.

questions.questionsTitle: a, b, c are in continued proportion. If a = 3 and c = 27 then find b.

subQuestion.question: a, b, c are in continued proportion. If a = 3 and c = 27 then find b.
subQuestion.ans: It is given that 3, b, 27 are in continued proportion.`therefore 3/b = b/27`⇒ `b^2 = 3 xx 27`⇒ `b^2 = 81`⇒ `b = sqrt81 = 9`Thus, the value of b is 9.

questions.questionsTitle: If a, b, c, d are in proportion, then prove that
If a, b, c, d are in proportion, then prove that

subQuestion.question: `sqrt[( a^2 + 5c^2)/( b^2 + 5d^2)] = a/b`
subQuestion.ans: It is given that a, b, c, d are in proportion.`therefore a/b = c/d = k`⇒ a = bk, c = dk`sqrt[( a^2 + 5c^2)/( b^2 + 5d^2)]`= `sqrt[(bk)^2 + 5(dk)^2]/(b^2 + 5d^2 )`= `sqrt[k^2( b^2 + 5d^2)]/(b^2 + 5d^2)`= `sqrt(k^2)`= k   ...(1)`a/b = [bk]/b = k`   ...(2)From (1) and (2), we get`sqrt([a^2 + 5c^2]/[b^2 + 5d^2]) = a/b`

subQuestion.ans: a, b, c are in continued proportion.`therefore a/b = b/c = k`⇒ `a = bk, b = ck`⇒ `a = bk = ck xx k = ck^2`LHS = `a/[ a + 2b] =  [ck^2]/[ ck^2 + 2 xx ck ]`= `[ck^2]/[ ck( k + 2) ]`= `k/( k + 2)`   ...(1)RHS = `[ a - 2b]/[ a - 4c ] = [ ck^2 - 2 xx ck]/[ ck^2 - 4c ]`= `[ck( k -2)]/[c(k^2 - 4)]`= `[k( k -2)]/[(k+2)(k-2)]`= `k/(k + 2)`   ...(2)From (1) and (2), we get`a/[ a + 2b] = [a - 2b]/[ a - 4c]`

subQuestion.ans: a, b, c are in continued proportion.`therefore a/b = b/c = k`⇒ `a = bk, b = ck`⇒ `a = bk = ck xx k = ck^2`LHS = `b/[ b + c] =  [ck]/[ ck + c] `= `[ck]/[ c( k + 1)]`= `k/( k + 1)`   ..(1)RHS = `[ a - b]/[ a - c ] = [ ck^2 - ck]/[ ck^2 - c ]`= `[ck( k -1)]/[c(k^2 - 1)]`= `[k( k -1)]/[(k-1)(k+1)]`= `k/(k + 1)`   ...(2)From (1) and (2), we get`b/[b+c] = [a-b]/[a-c]`

questions.questionsTitle: Alka spends 90% of the money that she receives every month, and saves Rs. 120. How much money does she get monthly?

subQuestion.question: Alka spends 90% of the money that she receives every month, and saves Rs. 120. How much money does she get monthly?
subQuestion.ans: Let her monthly income be Rs 'x'Savings = Rs 120Expenditure = 90% of x = `(90)/100 x`Income = Expenditure + Savingsx = `(90x)/100 + 120`x - 120 = `(90x)/100`100 (x - 120) = 90x100x - 12000 = 90x100x - 90x = 1200010x = 12000x = `12000/10`x = 1200Thus, total monthly salary = Rs 1200.

questions.questionsTitle: Nikhil spent 5% of his monthly income on his children's education, invested 14% in shares, deposited 3% in a bank and used 40% for his daily expenses. He was left with a balance of Rs. 19,000. What was his income that month?

subQuestion.question: Nikhil spent 5% of his monthly income on his children's education, invested 14% in shares, deposited 3% in a bank and used 40% for his daily expenses. He was left with a balance of Rs. 19,000. What was his income that month?
subQuestion.ans: Let the monthly income be Rs x = `100/100x`Money spent on children's education = `5%  "of"  x = 5/100x`Money spent on shares = `14%  "of"  x = 14/100x`Money deposited in banks = `3%  "of"  x = 3/100x`Money spent on daily expenses = `40%  "of"  x = 40/100x`Savings = `"Rs"  19,000``5/100x + 14/100x + 3/100x + 40/100x + 19000 = 100/100x`⇒ `62/100x + 19000 = 100/100x`⇒ `100/100x-62/100x = 19000`⇒ `38/100x = 19000`⇒ `x = 19000 xx 100/38`⇒ `x = 50000`

questions.questionsTitle: Sameera spent 90% of her income and donated 3% for socially useful causes. If she left with Rs. 1750 at the end of the month, what was her actual income?

subQuestion.question: Sameera spent 90% of her income and donated 3% for socially useful causes. If she left with Rs. 1750 at the end of the month, what was her actual income?
subQuestion.ans: Let Sameera's actual income be Rs x.Money spent = 90% of x =`90/100 x`Money donated = 3% of x = `3/100x`Money left = Rs 1750Money spent + money donated + money left = Total income⇒ `90/100x + 3/100x + 1750 = 100/100x`⇒ `100/100x - 93/100x = 1750`⇒ `7/100x = 1750`⇒ `7x = 175000`⇒ `x = 175000/7`⇒ `x = 25000`Thus, Sameera's actual income is Rs 25000.

questions.questionsTitle: Kailash used to spend 85% of his income. When his income increased by 36% his expenses also increased by 40% of his earlier expenses. How much percentage of his earnings he saves now?

subQuestion.question: Kailash used to spend 85% of his income. When his income increased by 36% his expenses also increased by 40% of his earlier expenses. How much percentage of his earnings he saves now?
subQuestion.ans: Let the Kailas's income be ₹ x.Kailash used to spend 85% of his income.∴ Money spent = `x xx 85/100`= ₹ `(85x)/100`Income − Expenditure = Savings`x - (85x)/100` = Savings∴ Savings = `(15x)/100`Kailash's income increased by 36%.∴ Kailash's increased income = `x + x xx 36/100`= `x + (36x)/100`= ₹ `(136x)/100`Kailash expenses increased by 40%.∴ Increased expenses of Kailash = `(85x)/100 + (85x)/100 xx 40/100`= `(85x)/100 + (34x)/100`= ₹ `(119x)/100`Kailash's current savings = Income - Expenditure= `(136x)/100 - (119x)/100`= ₹ `(17x)/100`Kailash's percentage of savings = `"Savings"/"Income" xx 100`= `(17x)/100 + (136x)/100 xx 100`=  `(17x)/100 + 100/(136x) xx 100`= 12.5Kailas now saves 12.5 percent of his earnings.

questions.questionsTitle: Total income of Ramesh, Suresh, and Preeti is 8,07,000 rupees. The percentages of their expenses are 75%, 80%, and 90% respectively. If the ratio of their savings is 16: 17: 12, then find the annual saving of each of them.
